snippet: The announcement that Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin would return as president dealt a heavy blow to President Dmitri A. Medvedev’s profile, suggesting that he meekly stepped away from a position he badly wanted.
abstract: Pres Dmitri A Medvedev of Russia is fighting to remain politically relevant as he prepares to cede the presidency to Prime Min Vladimir V Putin. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW -- President Dmitri A. Medvedev spent last Friday trying to persuade the grandees of United Russia that he is a conservative who can lead the party to victory. But many looked at him and saw Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin's liberal sidekick, who emboldened the opposition and supported the West in Libya. Mr. Medvedev did not fare any better on Saturday, when he met with the prominent liberals who had served as his human rights advisers. They made no effort to hide their disappointment in his presidency, saying an opportunity to change Russia had been allowed to slip away.

headline.main: Leaving the Presidency in Russia, Medvedev Fights for Relevance
